ai-snp3.5:1.2_0: At one time the Fortunate One was living near Rājagaha on the Vultures’ Peak Mountain.
ai-snp3.5:1.3_0: Then the student Māgha recited and exchanged greetings with the Buddha.
ai-snp3.5:1.4_0: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,
ai-snp3.5:1.5_0: While sat on one side the student Mātali said this to the Fortunate One:
ai-snp3.5:2.1_0: “I’m a giver, a donor, who speaks because I’m a giver.
ai-snp3.5:2.2_0: I seek wealth by legitimate means.
ai-snp3.5:2.3_0: When I seek wealth using legitimate, non-confusion with the teachings, and forty-four things. And also I don’t give even a single one of the four primary elements, or even more than ten.
ai-snp3.5:2.4_0: I hope it’s to give much merit.”
ai-snp3.5:3.2_0: The giver is a donor, a giver, begging, and borrowing.
ai-snp3.5:3.4_0: They seek wealth using legitimate, in accordance with the Teaching, and the wealth he gives them up. ...
ai-snp3.5:3.4_1: a giver of giving even more merit than that, even more much merit.”

ai-snp3.5:28.1_0: When he had spoken, Mātali said to the Buddha,
ai-snp3.5:28.3_0: “From this day forth, may the Buddha remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
